required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Flow Proportional Pressure Support in Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Flow Proportional Pressure Support as a New Mode of Spontaneous Breathing Assist - Evaluation of Objective and Subjective Measured Data in Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Flow proportional pressure support (FPPS) is a new mode of spontaneous breathing assistance. In patients with increased respiratory resistance the role of FPPS in comparison with the pressure support assist breathing mode is still unclear. In this study the investigators evaluate objective and subjective measured data in healthy volunteers with artificial increased resistance and FPPS breathing assistance.

intervention.intervention_name: artificial increased resistance (flow proportional pressure support)
intervention.description: respiratory resistance is increased by interpose of an artificial resistance tool in the in- and expiratory airways of the mechanical respirator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age over 18 years
- ASA I and II
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal of written informed consent
- chronic respiratory or cardiac diseases

clinical_study.keyword: breathing comfort and objective breathing data
